Class WithdrawalRequestRepository

java.lang.Object
database.WithdrawalRequestRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<WithdrawalRequest, String>
public class WithdrawalRequestRepository extends Object implements CrudRepository<WithdrawalRequest, String>
In-memory repository for managing WithdrawalRequest entities.

This repository provides CRUD operations for internship application withdrawal requests and supports CSV-based persistence. Withdrawal requests represent student requests to withdraw from internship applications, which require approval from career center staff.

The repository maintains withdrawal requests in insertion order using a LinkedHashMap for predictable iteration and export order. It includes domain-specific query methods for filtering by student, application, status, and internship.

    • findByApplicationId

      public Optional<WithdrawalRequest> findByApplicationId(String applicationId)
      Finds the first withdrawal request for a specific application.

      Note: Typically, there should be only one withdrawal request per application, but this method returns the first match if multiple exist.

      Parameters:
      applicationId - the application ID to search for
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the withdrawal request, or empty if not found

    • findPending

      public List<WithdrawalRequest> findPending()
      Finds all pending withdrawal requests.

      This is primarily used by career center staff to see requests awaiting review in their inbox.

      Returns:
      a list of all pending withdrawal requests
      See Also:
      • WithdrawalRequestStatus.PENDING

    • countPendingForInternship

      public long countPendingForInternship(String internshipId)
      Counts pending withdrawal requests affecting a specific internship.

      This can be used for dashboard displays to show how many pending withdrawal requests exist for a particular internship posting.

      Parameters:
      internshipId - the internship ID to count requests for
      Returns:
      the count of pending withdrawal requests for the specified internship

    • saveToCsv

      public void saveToCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Saves all withdrawal requests to a CSV file with standardized column headers.

      The CSV file is created with the following columns in this exact order:

      1. RequestID - Unique withdrawal request identifier
      2. ApplicationID - Reference to the associated application
      3. StudentID - Reference to the student who made the request
      4. RequestedOn - Date when the request was made (YYYY-MM-DD)
      5. Reason - Student's reason for withdrawal
      6. Status - Current status (PENDING, APPROVED, REJECTED)
      7. ProcessedBy - Staff member who processed the request (if any)
      8. ProcessedOn - Date when the request was processed (YYYY-MM-DD)
      9. StaffNote - Notes from staff regarding the decision

      Parent directories are created automatically if they don't exist. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

      Parameters:
      path - the output CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied

    • loadFromCsv

      public void loadFromCsv(String path, ApplicationRepository applications, StudentRepository students, CareerCenterStaffRepository staffRepo) throws IOException
      Loads withdrawal requests from a CSV file and resolves references to applications, students, and staff using the provided repositories.

      This method performs entity resolution where:

      • Application IDs are resolved using the applications repository
      • Student IDs are resolved using the students repository
      • Staff IDs are resolved using the staffRepo repository
      Rows with unresolved references (missing applications or students) are skipped with an error message.

      The CSV file can use various column headers for each field:

      • Application ID: "applicationid", "app", "application"
      • Student ID: "studentid", "student"
      • Processed By: "processedby", "processedbystaffid", "staffid"
      • Staff Note: "staffnote", "note"

      Status restoration logic:

      • APPROVED/REJECTED status requires a valid staff member for processing
      • If staff reference is missing for processed requests, status remains PENDING
      • PENDING status is maintained by default
      Parameters:
      path - the input CSV file path
      applications - the application repository for resolving application references
      students - the student repository for resolving student references
      staffRepo - the staff repository for resolving staff references
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied
